name: MATLAB
description: Installs MATLAB with supporting packages and tools.

products.description: Products to install, specified as a list of space-separated product names.</br> For details, see [Input Arguments to MATLAB Package Manager](https://mathworks.com/help/install/ug/mpminstall.html#mw_982f28f7-dc9f-482e-83c7-63c46ad9126f).

doc.description: Flag to install documentation and examples (R2022b and earlier releases).

installGpu.description: Skips installation of GPU libraries when you install Parallel Computing Toolbox (R2023a and later releases).

destination.description: Full path to the installation destination folder. Default: /opt/matlab/${RELEASE^}

installMatlabProxy.description: Installs matlab-proxy and its dependencies (R2020b and later releases).

installJupyterMatlabProxy.description: Installs jupyter-matlab-proxy and its dependencies (R2020b and later releases).

installMatlabEngineForPython.description: Installs the MATLAB Engine for Python if the destination option is set correctly.

networkLicenseManager.description: MATLAB will use the specified Network License Manager.

skipMATLABInstall.description: Set to true if you do not want to install MATLAB, for example if you only want to install `matlab-proxy` or `jupyter-matlab-proxy`.

enableTelemetry.description: Set to false to disable telemetry that helps improve this feature. For more information, See: [User Experience Information FAQ](https://mathworks.com/support/faq/user_experience_information_faq.html)

postStartCommand: ( ls ~/.startmatlabdesktop >> /dev/null 2>&1 && env MWI_APP_PORT=8888 matlab-proxy-app 2>/dev/null ) || echo 'Will not start matlab-proxy-app...'
